text: Answer: 4.5 Solution: At 8 MHz, the processor has a clock period of 0.125 microseconds, so that an instruction cycle takes 12 x 0.125 = 1.5 microseconds. To check status requires one input-type instruction to read the device status register, plus at least one other instruction to examine the register contents. If the device is ready, one output-type instruction is needed to present data to the device handler. The total is 3 instructions, requiring 4.5 us.
